name: Modern Hotel and Bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights on a recent trip to Boise. The hotel has a courtyard and is a good location for a small party. Excellent food and creative cocktails in the bar. Prices are good also and the bar has a good mix of travelers and locals. All the staff were friendly, efficient and customer focused. The general manager, Michal, the bar manager, Remi, and Ryan the barman were all just delightful and made our stay relaxing and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Service impecable and perfect location
Fully renovated motel, now a hip trendy spot in downtown Boise
reviews.text: Rooms are well appointed and very clean. Only complaint is that the shower is possibly too clever for its own good; the stream comes directly from the ceiling and lacked pressure. But the Aveda products supplied were a nice addition. And the bathtub was just great.
Located on the edge of downtown and in the recently revitalised 'Linen District', the Modern is highly recommended.
reviews.title: I actually miss this hotel when I leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at The Modern for 3 nights while visiting family in Boise.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: It's quite a unique place, rather hard to describe. It looks like they took an old motor lodge and did an EXTENSIVE renovation. Not just new paint and carpeting, but everything from floor to ceiling.
reviews.title: I wish every city had a Modern Hotel

reviews.text: Okay so disclaimer, I've never been to Boise before and don't know anything about the other hotels but The Modern has ensured that it will be the only place we stay and will recommend it to anyone visiting Boise.
reviews.title: The only place I'll stay in Boise!
good location, fun decor
reviews.text: BF and I went to Boise for a Memorial Day weekend. We're pretty laid back people and don't expect too much from our hotels but sometimes like a splurge of character. The Modern was super cool and the rooms were beautiful.

The Good: Gorgeous rooms. The room we stayed in looked almost exactly like the one in the listed photo. Very stylish. BF and I are fans of mid century modern and loved the look of the room. Same can be said of the grounds of the hotel. BF thought that it might have been one of the coolest looking hotels he has ever stayed in. I agreed. Aveda toiletries. LCD flat screen TVs. We watched the local news over, and over, and over again. Haha. The staff was super friendly and check-in was quick and easy. The complimentary breakfast was nice. Light meal with yogurt, crossiants (love crossiants!) with fresh squeezed oranged juice. I want more! Wrapped it up with Tazo teas. It wasn't very busy when we were at breakfast around 10 am. It ends at 10:30 am. Location is great and convienient to the tourist sights. Walking distance to downtown Boise and all the bars but not close enough that you would hear any of it. I'm not sure if Boise is always like this but on Memorial Day weekend, it was almost like Spring Break! Tons of scantily clad women and bros all over the bar scene. Seemed like everyone in ther 20s were out on the streets.
reviews.title: Well done

reviews.text: The No-So-Good: When we first got there, it was a little intimdating because there was a very loud, semi-belligerent, and large group of people hanging out in front of their balcony rooms. But they headed out to the bars almost immediately after our arrival. Not really the fault of the hotel but I imagine they disturbed a few people. Also they didn't have a pool, which normally love but I knew this before we booked it.
reviews.title: ALL Staff is the best! Rooms could use some REAL cleaning!

reviews.text: The Bad: None
reviews.title: Cool rooms in Boise

reviews.text: I never stayed in a Travelodge, but remember seeing them as a kid, and I really liked the work the Modern team has done to make the property a unique mid-century modern travel experience. Granted the place isn't opulent, but it is extremely comfortable and well-turned out, with Aveda toiletries, complimentary business center, continental breakfast with fresh-squeezed juices, rainshower bath, i-pod dock, and great bedding with triple sheeting, which is becoming less and less common.
reviews.title: The Modern: A Unique Take on a Blast From the Past

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar area and outdoor courtyard make it easy to stay at the hotel to socialize, but the rest of the city is just a few minutes away by foot. As others have mentioned, the Boise Greenbelt is a great place to exercise, Big City Coffee just down the street makes for a good stop, and the shops, restaurants, and capitol building make Boise a pleasant place to knock off a day.
reviews.title: Cool place with great staff

reviews.text: The hotel just switched over to the complimentary service of the Boise Shuttle to and from the airport. I called the hotel upon deplaning and only waited a couple of minutes for the shuttle, which took only 20 minutes both going to the hotel and back to the airport. Boise lacks a true luxury hotel and I don't find the Grove to be impressive, so I lean toward either Hotel 43 or The Modern. You get a bit more luxury at Hotel 43, but for something memorable and unique, The Modern is the game to beat right now.
reviews.title: Cool hotel and wonderful, wonderful food and staff.

reviews.text: Loved the Modern. The bar was one of my favorite parts. The drinks were very creative and delicious! The room was quite comfortable and the shower was nice. Everything was clean and the staff was very nice. I will stay here again.
reviews.title: convenient to downtown

reviews.text: If you are tall, up to 8 feet tall, the showers here are made for you. They come out of the ceiling in a large shower stall. The beds and decor are from the 1960s but of nice quality and style. The bed was wonderful. The food at the bar was gourmet quality and very good--cooked by a chef. The people were warm and friendly. It has a nice breakfast served in the bar. The bar is light and airy--very pleasant atmosphere. The hotel is centrally located to ge anywhere in Boise you would like to go. We really enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Stayed in Modern for 3 weeks, Strongly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a terrific stay at The Modern Hotel in Boise. Let me clarify two things, one I have stayed at great and interesting hotels all over the world and two I have been in the hotel industry for 11 years.
reviews.title: Lesson in Hospitality

reviews.text: Sure the hotel was hip, the design element was great, the beds were bliss, the showers were a delight to wake-up to.... but the ture essence of The Modern is in the great hospitality exhibited by the staff. Here is a true lesson in expert hospitality:
reviews.title: nice stay at the modern

reviews.text: We stayed at the Modern on our way from Seattle to Sun Valley to see old friends. I think my husband who is an Architect was a little taken back at first but the minute he walked in the door the camera came out. That says "a lot". We loved everything about this hotel. We were traveling with our teen so we got a suite and were not disappointed by anything. We went down to the bar for a cocktail after a long drive and it was fantastic. The bartender was friendly and informative about the property itself.
reviews.title: Our new fave in Boise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone here has described the place so I have nothing to add other than way chic, way retro, and way cool!!
reviews.title: not a single complaint

likes.liked: — the bar scene. get those bartenders a raise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the place so much that we hauled our Boise friends back for a drink around the fire pits. I wish we had more than one night to enjoy the Modern. The cost of the suite was 200.00 with breakfast which was worth it.
reviews.title: Hip, Special and a spring board to a happening little visit to Boise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trip Advisor - you've never let me down!!
reviews.title: Loved the Modern!

likes.liked: — The decor and atmosphere was great

reviews.text: stayed friday night, having booked a basic room a few days earlier using the hotel's website, for about $110. we arrived about half an hour prior to the scheduled check-in time, but were very pleasantly greeted and checked in without hesitation.
reviews.title: Hio CAN happen in Boise

reviews.text: We (a family from Paris, France) stayed one night at Modern Hotel on our way to Seattle. Hotel very nicely remodeled, great suite with a lot of space and an impressive bathroom, very good breakfast, well everything was great ... until I looked at my account when getting back home. I had payed twice for the room, payed through Expedia, and then charged again on my Visa card. And it took my 2 months, 3 phone calls, several mails without answers, until I got angry, and finally got reimbursed after some fighting. So if you stay there, you'll be happy, but watch out your account !
reviews.title: Everything great but ...

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here while travelling across the country. It was sort of what you'd expect a modern hotel to look like if it was the 60s. Kind of funky, clean straight lines, big rooms, form before function bathrooms... We had a suite, which was nice, a separate bedroom, and the bathroom was enormous with a separate tub and shower with waterfall spout from the ceiling. It was quiet, the staff was friendly, and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who ended up in miserable Boise, ID. Oh yeah, you could walk to all the amazing nightlife of Boise from here. Not too shabby.
reviews.title: Cool hotel, who knew?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable, great ambient and live music in the patio.
reviews.title: Brand new hotel, white minimal decoration and an awesome bathroom.

reviews.text: Grat cocktails in the bar as well.
reviews.title: Wish I was here earlier...

reviews.text: I arrived late in the evening after a long drive, and wished I had arrived earlier to try the cocktails in the cool-looking bar. Had one of the best sleeps ever on the road - the bed is exceptionally comfortable. Great design without being over-the-top trendy in the room, excellent attention to detail (I took one of the cardboard coasters and the Aveda products from the bathroom). Big LCD TV, walk-in shower, cool "mini-bar" amenities. This was great value, on the edge of downtown Boise. Complimentary morning coffee, juice, croissants and yogurt are all good quality, matching the environment of the hotel.
reviews.title: Unimpressed

reviews.text: Stayed at the Modern on a Monday and booked it again for Friday on the return trip--the same room, a Queen suite. Excellent accommodations and attention to detail. Helpful front desk women pointed us to a fabulous dinner at the Red Feather the first night and to an interesting restaurant in the Basque district on our return. The bed was luxurious as was the Japanese soaking tub with Aveda bath salts. The Modern Bar was busy on Friday--and loud with Boise State graduation revelers--but closes at 10 on Monday evenings. We loved the outdoor firepit. Would recommend this elegant, hip hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: The Best of Boise

likes.liked: — Cool retro furnishings, minimalist decor, Aveda products

reviews.text: I've been staying at various places in Boise for over 2 years, including bed and breakfasts and some hotels. This is the best! The mattresses are absolutely, hands down, the best sleep I've ever had. And the pillows were fantastic. The rooms are simple, clean, and of course modern. And the location is fantastic! I loved the quirky stores and eating within walking distance. Stay here! It is awesome!
reviews.title: The best place in Boise

likes.disliked: — Nothing - they did a great job

reviews.text: Had to travel to Boisefor one night and found the Modern Hotel on TripAdvisor. I was not disappointed! The redesign of this Travelodge is excellent using Herman Miller and Eames touches throughout the entire place. The front desk people were very friendly and casual which was a nice departure from some of the boutique hotels I have visited recently.
reviews.title: Mid-Century Modern Motel

reviews.text: My room was spacious and I loved the bathroom. I did not have an iron & board in my room but I called the front desk and they brought one to me in 5 minutes (and picked it up when I was finished).
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My rate was only $80 and I am sure that hotels are not expensive in Boise but this place was above and beyond the rate. I would stay here again in a second!
reviews.title: Wonderful Oasis after a Long Drive!

likes.disliked: — Wifi was patchy, but couldn't be helped

description: Experience this intimate boutique hotel, where architecture and design live in harmony. ADA-compliant. Free parking for walk-up comfort and convenience. Adjacent to the Linen Building Event Center, The Modern Hotel is the ideal spot for meetings and creative professionals taking care of business. Onsite, our business center has all the hook-ups you need to tie up loose ends while you're away.
